betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Forestry offers singleblock farms which will farm materials when provided with dirt, water, power, and fertilizer. Each kind of farm comes in two variants of each farm: managed and manual. Managed farms will automatically place down blocks and harvest them when ready, manual will require you to place them down so managed are best of them. The farms will place blocks in a 3 thick square ring 4 blocks away from the farm block and 1 block below it.

Note that these farms take very little power so you can run multiple of them based off of a single stirling engine.

Below are the different variants and any quirks with them:

Arboretum:
Lets you place based on cardinal directions. If you put it fruit trees it just cuts them down, you'll need a multiblock farm for them.

Peat Bog:
Takes in Bog Earth and outputs Peat and dirt

Crop Farm:
Same as Arboretum

Shroom Farm:
Takes in Mycelium or Podzol then works same as arboretum farm, chopping them down when they grow up

Gourd Farm:
Same as the crop farm.

Netherwart:
Uses soulsand instead of dirt and doesn't need water

End Flower:
Uses endstone instead of dirt and doesn't need water, it also doesn't filter chorus flower back into input so you will need to do that.
